page.title: 17THE BEST KEPT VILLAGE
page.content: In South Yorkshire there is a {competition}every three years for the best kept village.{Fenwick}has entered this competiton ever since it started in 1959. A week before this takes place people go around Fenwick and pick up rubbish and litter. Most people hide their dustbins to make it look cleaner. They hang flowers in baskets and mow their lawns. They were runners-up in 1976 and{winners}in 1982. The winners receive a seat which remains in the village for all time and trees are planted in the village. The cleanest village is judged by a committee of people from the area. This means{Fenwick}is one of the cleanest villages in South Yorkshire.
